intro: Arctotis purpurea, commonly known as the purple arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers in shades of purple and white. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Arctotis purpurea is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
